title: Protective Clothing Against Biological Agents
brief: How to use clothing and basic materials to protect against biological agent exposure.
steps: Step 1: Cover face with cloth when no protective mask available to protect against aerosols.
Step 2: Wear mask when dust is present - dust may contain biological agents.
Step 3: Button clothing completely and tuck trousers tightly into boots.
Step 4: Wear chemical protective overgarment if available for better protection.
Step 5: Keep all skin covered to prevent agent entry through cuts or scratches.
Step 6: Wash clothing in hot, soapy water or lay in bright sunlight to kill microorganisms.
warnings: Some toxins can penetrate unbroken skin unlike germs
Incomplete skin coverage allows vector bites and agent entry
Without proper covering, vectors can transmit diseases through bites
